intro: Tapeinidium marginale, commonly known as the marginate tapeinidium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its distinctive, palmately lobed leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, often accompanied by bracts. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in savanna and woodland habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
